Exploration Activities

Activities while exploring dungeons, wilderness, and settlements

Common Exploration Activities

While traveling or exploring, characters can perform various activities. The party can have different members doing different activities.

Drawing a Map

Make an Intelligence (Investigation) or Wisdom (Survival) check to create an accurate map of the area.

  • Provides bonuses for future navigation
  • Can be shared with other parties
  • Requires cartographer's tools for best results

Foraging

Make a Wisdom (Survival) check to find food and water:

  • DC 10: Find enough food and water for one person
  • DC 15: Find enough for 2-5 people
  • DC 20: Find enough for 6+ people
  • Abundant areas: Advantage on check
  • Barren areas: Disadvantage on check

Navigating

Make a Wisdom (Survival) check to avoid getting lost:

  • Required in wilderness without clear paths
  • DC varies by terrain and weather
  • One check per day of travel
  • Maps and navigation tools provide Advantage

Tracking

Make a Wisdom (Survival) check to follow tracks:

  • DC based on how long ago tracks were made
  • Fresh tracks (1 hour): DC 10
  • Recent tracks (1 day): DC 15
  • Old tracks (1 week): DC 20
  • Rain or heavy traffic: Increase DC by 5

Keeping Watch

Make a Wisdom (Perception) check to notice threats:

  • Passive Perception for routine watch
  • Active check if specifically searching
  • Disadvantage if distracted or doing another activity

Sneaking

Group Dexterity (Stealth) check to move quietly:

  • All party members make checks
  • Success if more than half succeed
  • Slow travel pace required
  • Heavy armor imposes Disadvantage

Splitting the Party

Party members can split up to perform different activities:

  • One character navigates
  • One or two keep watch (front/rear)
  • One draws a map
  • Others forage or track

Vision and Light

Exploration is affected by lighting conditions:

  • Bright Light: Normal Perception
  • Dim Light: Disadvantage on Perception (sight)
  • Darkness: Blinded (unless special vision)
  • Light sources: Torches (20 ft bright, 20 ft dim), lanterns (30/30 ft), candles (5 ft bright)

Resting During Exploration

  • Short Rest: 1 hour of rest, can spend Hit Dice
  • Long Rest: 8 hours, regain HP and spell slots
  • Interruptions can prevent rest benefits
